page.title: 08GRAND BRIDGE
page.content: Blenheim Bridge is quite long. It is built from Cotswold stone and is between 30 and 40 feet above the lake. The road over the bridge goes from the palace to the monument, North lodge, two farms, and other parts of the park. There are some rooms in the bridge. A woman used to live there. Before she lived there she made clothes for one of the dukes. The bridge was built by the original landscaper and just crossed the river Glyme. This grand construction looked out of place across a small river and so Capability Brown conceived the idea of the lakes which has put the bridge in a setting once described as the finest view in England.
